title: The following error was constructed but not emitted: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
use futures::future::{self, BoxFuture};

fn inject<'a, Env: 'a, A: 'a + Send>(v: A) -> Box<dyn FnOnce(&'a Env) -> BoxFuture<'a, A>> {
    let fut: BoxFuture<'a, A> = Box::pin(future::ready(v));
    Box::new(move |_| fut)
}

fn main() {}
```
[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=30f4445ed0f97cf822a7510dd9f0af28)

### Meta
The bug does not appear on beta or nightly.

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.45.2 (d3fb005a3 2020-07-31)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: d3fb005a39e62501b8b0b356166e515ae24e2e54
commit-date: 2020-07-31
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.45.2
LLVM version: 10.0
```

### Error output

```

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

```
